H0.text: Dinosaurs are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

H1.text: Snakes are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

H2.text: Trees are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

H3.text: Trilobites are the best-known extinct vertebrates.

A4.text: Dinosaurs were the dominant terrestrial vertebrates of the Mesozoic Era, especially the Jurassic and Cretaceous periods.

A5.text: Dinosaurs have always been recognized as an extremely varied group: over 900 non-avian dinosaur genera have been confidently identified (2018) with 1124 species (2016).
